Body:
I'm doing a Internet of Thing(IoT) project, and I follow a sample from below sources. But I fail at last step when I push to start this app. https://www.ibm.com/blogs/bluemix/2015/04/tutorial-using-a-raspberry-pi-python-iot-twilio-bluemix/

1. I am using 'cf push to start the app'
column9: it works until crash. 2. I am using 'cf logs python-iot-hackathon2 --recent' to see logs
column10:
and there are two errors

3. There is a python code that given from tutorial source
column11: i think i should edit the code from line7~12
column12: but I do not know how. If there is another problem
column13:
please teach me how to do it. Thanks.

ex. There are two error
column14:
if you can not see clearly. 1. Err: You must give at least one requirement to install (see "pip help install")

2. Err: Traceback (most recent call last): Err: File "server.py". line12
column17:
line 20. in new_func Err: .format(func.name) Err: twilio.base.obsolete.obsoleteException: TwilioRestClient has been removed from this version of the library. Please refer to current documentation for guidance.

"

Body:
For: 1. Err: You must give at least one requirement to install (see pip help install")

You need to run this on the Raspberry PI:

sudo pip install twilio

If you don't have pip installed then run:

sudo apt-get install python3-pip

and then again: sudo pip install twilio

for 2. Err: Traceback (most recent call last): Err: File "server.py". line12

Basically the twilio client definition needs to be similar to:

from twilio.rest import Client

client = Client(account_sid
column10:
line 12 in server.py should be similar to

from twilio.rest import Client //this should be also changed

twilioClient = Client(account_sid

Body: After I install twilio, it has a error Command python setup.py egg_info" failed with error code 1 in /tmp/pip-build-sCUBeM/cryptography/ How to solve this problem? My python version is 2.7.9 now. And about defind account_sid
column10: should i put real code for both of them? Thanks"

Body: looks like you are missing some required packages		for this particular issue this would be enough		sudo pip install cryptography		You need to follow that recipe step by step. On step 33 it say that you need to install some requirements as below:		sudo pip install -r requirements.txt		The file can be found on this repo:		https://github.com/IBM-Bluemix/python-iot-raspberry-pi
Thanks. It works after I edit python code, like you said from line 7~12.
